Generation III.Ruby: Every time Absol appears before people, it is followed by a disaster such as an earthquake or a tidal wave. As a result, it came to be known as the disaster Pok é mon .
Generation III.Sapphire: Absol has the ability to foretell the coming of natural disasters. It lives in a harsh, rugged mountain environment. This Pok é mon very rarely ventures down from the mountains.
Generation III.Emerald: It sharply senses even subtle changes in the sky and the land to predict natural disasters. It is a long-lived Pok é mon that has a life-span of 100 years.
Generation III.FireRed: It appears when it senses an impending natural disaster. As a result, it was mistaken as a doom-bringer.
Generation III.LeafGreen: It appears when it senses an impending natural disaster. As a result, it was mistaken as a doom-bringer.

Generation IV.Diamond: It senses coming disasters and appears before people only to warn them of impending danger.
Generation IV.Pearl: It senses coming disasters and appears before people only to warn them of impending danger.
Generation IV.Platinum: Rumored to sense disasters with its horn, it became a target. It fled deep into the mountains.
Generation IV.HeartGold: It has the ability to foretell natural disasters. Its life span is over a hundred years.
Generation IV.SoulSilver: It has the ability to foretell natural disasters. Its life span is over a hundred years.

Generation V.Black: Rumored to sense disasters with its horn, it became a target. It fled deep into the mountains.
Generation V.White: Rumored to sense disasters with its horn, it became a target. It fled deep into the mountains.
Generation V.Black 2: It appears from deep in the mountains to warn people about upcoming disasters it has sensed with its horn.
Generation V.White 2: It appears from deep in the mountains to warn people about upcoming disasters it has sensed with its horn.

Generation VI.X: It senses coming disasters and appears before people only to warn them of impending danger.
Generation VI.Y: It appears when it senses an impending natural disaster. As a result, it was mistaken as a doom bringer.
Generation VI.Omega Ruby: Every time Absol appears before people, it is followed by a disaster such as an earthquake or a tidal wave. As a result, it came to be known as the disaster Pokémon.
Generation VI.Alpha Sapphire: Absol has the ability to foretell the coming of natural disasters. It lives in a harsh, rugged mountain environment. This Pokémon very rarely ventures down from the mountains.

Generation VII.Sun: When this Pokémon whips the winglike fur on its back as though beating its wings, it sends an intimidating aura flying at its opponents.
Generation VII.Moon: As the energy of Mega Evolution fills it, its fur bristles. What you see on its back are not true wings, and this Pokémon isn't able to fly.
Generation VII.Ultra Sun: Normally, it dislikes fighting, so it really hates changing to this form for battles.
Generation VII.Ultra Moon: It converts the energy from Mega Evolution into an intimidating aura. Fainthearted people expire from shock at the sight of it.

Generation VIII.Sword: Swift as the wind, Absol races through fields and mountains. Its curved, bow-like horn is acutely sensitive to the warning signs of natural disasters.
Generation VIII.Shield: Because of this Pokémon's ability to detect danger, people mistook Absol as a bringer of doom.
Generation VIII.Brilliant Diamond: It senses coming disasters and appears before people only to warn them of impending danger.
Generation VIII.Shining Pearl: It senses coming disasters and appears before people only to warn them of impending danger.
